Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with added red and white bands; exterior: black band above lotus flower and bud frieze part-preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Hayes compares this sherd with others from Tocra and identifies them as similar to Tocra Type II Chian chalices. The lotus flower and bud motif is found on Wild Goat Style chalices and the lack of interior decoration also suggests that the sherd may be earlier in the Wild Goat Style, rather than in the later Mature Animal style. For parallels regarding the lotus motif, see Lemos 1991, pl. 11-2, no. 114 from Emporio; pl. 13, no. 124 from Rizari. For parallels regarding the exterior decoration, see British Museum 1924,1201.525.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 266, no. 591, pl. 74)
Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 206-7, N13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0229) (phase 2)
